de.cocolab.reuse
Class CocktailWriter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.io.Writer
        |
        +--java.io.FilterWriter
              |
              +--de.cocolab.reuse.CocktailWriter
public class CocktailWriter
extends java.io.FilterWriter

Print formatted representations of objects to a text stream.

This class knows how to format various objects found in a Cocktail application for humans to read, or for interchange with a Cocktail application written in a language other than Java.

The string equivalent of the value to be output is translated into bytes according to the platform's default character encoding.

Version:
$Id: $

public CocktailWriter(java.io.Writer out,
                      boolean autoFlush)
Create a new CocktailWriter.

Parameters:
out - A character-output stream
autoFlush - A boolean; if true, the writeNl() method will flush the output buffer

CocktailWriter

public CocktailWriter(java.io.OutputStream out)
Create a new CocktailWriter, without automatic line flushing, from an existing OutputStream. This convenience constructor creates the necessary intermediate OutputStreamWriter, which will convert characters into bytes using the default character encoding.

Parameters:
out - An output stream

CocktailWriter

public CocktailWriter(java.io.OutputStream out,
                      boolean autoFlush)
Create a new CocktailWriter from an existing OutputStream. This convenience constructor creates the necessary intermediate OutputStreamWriter, which will convert characters into bytes using the default character encoding.

Parameters:
out - An output stream
autoFlush - A boolean; if true, the println() methods will flush the output buffer

Output an integer value at its natural width. See also a method for writing a fixed width.

Overrides:
write in class java.io.FilterWriter
Parameters:

write

public void write(int n,
                  int fieldWidth)
           throws java.io.IOException
Output an integer value, padding with spaces on the left as required to give a specified minimum width. If the number is too large to fit in the space requested, it is output in full.

Parameters:
n - The integer value to be printed
fieldWidth - The minimum space to be occupied by the number.

writeN

public void writeN(long n,
                   int fieldWidth,
                   int base)
            throws java.io.IOException
Print a long integer in a fixed width format and specified number base. The number is assumed to be unsigned, and is padded on the left with zeros.

Parameters:
n - The long to be printed
fieldWidth - Minimum number of digits to be printed
base - Base to be used (up to 16)

write

public void write(double n,
                  int before,
                  int after,
                  int exp)
           throws java.io.IOException
Print a real (double-precision) floating-point number in a fixed width format.

Parameters:
n - The double to be printed
before - Number of digits before the decimal point
after - Number of digits after the decimal point
exp - Number of digits in the exponent (zero specifies output is to be in decimal form without exponent).
